page.title: 01Introduction To Westhill
page.content: Westhill lies 15km west of Aberdeen in North East Scotland.It is situated on the ridge between the Dee & Don ; the land is undulating and typical of {Glacial Deposition},resulting from the Dee Glaciers melting in this area. The Soil varies from light sandy{LOAM on the higher ground to{CLAY}and{PEAT} on low lying parts; all are stoney. The areas prevailing westerly wind is strong,due to the exposed site;the whole area is dry being in the rain shadow of the{Grampian Mountains}.The south eastern corner of the area lies in a small depression creating a{Frost {Hollow.} The main features of this area are the Hill of Keir,at 222 metres ,the Garden Suburb of Westhill in the south east,the village of Kirton of Skene, Easter Skene Woods to the west;the remaining area being{Agricultural.}
